mark actor properties nonisolated where it isn't inferred

swift 6 began generating a warning that `await` is required when accessing
`let` properties on actors where the type is not `sendable`. (if the type is
`sendable`, they are automatically inferred to be `nonisolated`.)

this resolves that specific warning, but would generate different warnings
under strict concurrency checking or swift 6 mode. the ultimate solution should
be to audit these types for sendability.
audit attachmentdownloadmanagerimpl.progressstates for sendability
audit owsoperation for sendability
directly adopt keyvaluestore in sdskeyvaluestore
fix indentation in atomics.swift
bench memory usage in backups

add tsmutex to replace unfairlock

renames unfairlock to tsmutex and refreshes its interface to remove methods
that are unused except in tests.

tsmutex has a generic parameter state that supports non-sendable and
non-copyable values. unfairlock is a type alias of tsmutex<void>.

the withlock() function is also no longer inherited from nslocking, instead
being implemented to be similar to osallocatedunfairlock's api.

finally, the class is audited for sendability and compiles without warnings
under strict concurrency checking.

simplify chatlistfiltercontrol with independent istracking property

by using `istracking` to control explicitly whether content offset changes
should affect layout & animation progress, the `state` enum, layout, and
animation all become simpler.

also fixes an issue where stopping the drag while the filter icon is partly
visible would stop adjusting the content offset, causing the filter icon to
momentarily appear stuck as the scroll bounce finishes.

don't deallocate uiviewpropertyanimator until completion handlers run

completion handler to do the clean-up should ensure the animator isn't
deallocated too early.

fix wrong thread being selected on launch from notification

when opening a thread from a notification, if the thread being opened has
changed position due to activity in other threads, the table selection and view
state get out of sync.

after selecting the new thread, we need to ensure the chat list is actually
reloaded from the database, so we can update the selected index path once more
in case it has changed.

fix ios 18 crash on launch due to offscreen rendering

creating a uiimageview outside a view hierarchy now crashes on ios 18. we can
avoid this offscreen rendering technique by removing uiimage.astintedimage(),
configuring the tint colour and template rendering on the uiimage directly, and
rendering with uigraphicsimagerenderer instead of lower-level core graphics
apis.

update to libsignal v0.55.1

maintain section titles when unread filter is active

previously, section titles were enabled dynamically based on whether both the
pinned & unpinned sections had chats in them. this meant that if the unread
filter was active, section titles might disappear, making it unclear whether
the chat is pinned or not.

section titles are now always turned on when there is at least one pinned chat,
and continue to be displayed when the unread filter is active.
